newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines sets 1998 budget at 540.8 bln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Philippines sets 1998 budget at 540.8 bln pesos.

text.p: The Philippines is preparing a 1998 budget worth 540.8 billion pesos, budget secretary Salvador Enriquez said on Thursday.
"We will propose ...a budget amounting to some 540.8 billion pesos, growing by about 13.6 percent over the 493.1 billion effective budget for 1997," Enriquez said in a statement.
The 1998 level will generate a fiscal surplus of 16.0 billion pesos, and a public sector surplus of about 9.0 billion pesos.
"The surplus will raise public savings for investment needs, check inflationary pressure, reduce the public debt and consequently expand the private sector's access to credit," he added.
Enriquez said 84.6 percent of the proposed 1998 budget will be channelled to productive expenditures while only 15.4 percent to debt and interest payments.
In the 1997 budget, which is to be signed by President Fidel Ramos in the next few days, 15.3 percent of expenditure will on debt servicing.
The 1998 budget is expected to support an economic growth target of 7.5 percent, Enriquez added.
